alert.note: Alert for Hampden (Massachusetts) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued July 12 at 1:55PM EDT until July 14 at 8:00AM EDT by NWS Boston
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Connecticut...Massachusetts... Connecticut River At Thompsonville affecting Hampden and Hartford Counties. Connecticut River At Northampton affecting Hampden and Hampshire Counties. Connecticut River At Montague affecting Hampshire and Franklin Counties. ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Massachusetts...Connecticut... Connecticut River ABOVE Holyoke Dam affecting Hampden County. Connecticut River At Hartford affecting Hartford and Middlesex Counties. For the Connecticut River...including Montague, Northampton, Holyoke Dam, Holyoke, Springfield, Thompsonville, Hartford, Middle Haddam... Moderate flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL FRIDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Connecticut River at Thompsonville. * WHEN...Until Friday morning. * IMPACTS...At 17.0 feet, Flooding will become more widespread along the Connecticut River from the Massachusetts towns of Agawam and Longmeadow, through the northern Connecticut towns of Suffield and Enfield. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 12:30 PM EDT Wednesday the stage was 16.9 feet. - Bankfull stage is 5.0 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 12:30 PM EDT Wednesday was 17.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 17.0 feet this afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage early Friday morning. - Flood stage is 15.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 17.0 feet on 12/23/1974. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this evening at 645 PM EDT.
